node.text:
We are delighted to share our competition proposal in collaboration with @vogtlandscape and @arupgroup. 

The Tuchkov Buyan project creates a new park on the banks of the Malaya Neva river in the heart of St. Petersburg. Studying the history of the site, several historical maps were overlapped to reveal the gradual changes of its identity and geometry.

Our architectural landscape proposal received 2nd prize in the competition announcement last week. 

Watch the full project video on our IGTV. 

#herzogdemeuron #hdm542 #tuchkovbuyanpark #stpetersburg

node.text:
SOUND ON “A rehabilitation centre is a place where people live for up to 18 months, usually after an accident. Because the patients are so restricted, because they have to stay at the REHAB centre for such a long time, we have set ourselves the task of designing a multifunctional, diversified building, almost like a small town with streets, plazas, gardens, public facilities, and more secluded residential quarters where people take different paths to move from A to B. We have tried to create surroundings that allow the patients as much autonomy as possible.”
 
More on REHAB Basel and other HdM hospitals in the link in our bio.
 
Project completed in 2002, extension completed in 2019. 15th year anniversary photographs by Katalin Deér, 2016.
 
#herzogdemeuron #hdm_hospitals #hdm165 #rehabbasel #basel

node.text:
On the occasion of the recent exhibition ‘Retail Apocalypse’ at gta exhibitions, ETH Zurich, the curators Fredi Fischli and Niels Olsen (@fredi_niels_official) organized a call with Jacques. Starting from our retail work developed with Prada and Miu Miu, the conversation touched on many projects across four decades of practice from the Blue House to the Autobahnkirche. Check out our IGTV to watch the full video.

#herzogdemeuron #hdm178 #hdm412 #ethzurich #gtaexhibitions

node.title: Retail Apocalypse. Jacques Herzog, Fredi Fischli and Niels Olsen

node.text:
ST International HQ and SongEun Art Space, HdM’s first realized project in Korea, is nearing completion and is set to open in September 2021. Located within the heart of Cheongdam Dong, the project will offer non-commercial art spaces within one of the most commercial areas of Seoul. In addition to providing SongEun Art and Cultural Foundation with a variety of new exhibition spaces, the building will house offices for ST International. 
 
A sharp triangular volume distinguishes the architectural project; a tall front façade faces the main street and a low back façade faces the garden, where a more intimate scale defines the surrounding neighborhood. The triangular shape results from exploiting the sculptural potential of the zoning laws. An experimental and unexpected mix of gallery spaces, offices, and public areas unfolds above and below ground, creating a complex that invites the public to engage with contemporary art in Seoul.
 
The concrete surface of the façade is textured using wooden formwork, alluding to the meaning of SongEun: “Hidden Pine Tree”. On one side of the building, a cut out of the base invites visitors from the street to the main lobby and a garden while, on the other, a ramp leads to parking below. The curve of the descending ramp carves an opening in the ceiling of an underground exhibition space, connecting it to the activity, sound, and light from street-level. Above ground, the ramp’s spiral volume continues as a stair bringing visitors up to the second-floor galleries. 

@songeunartspace 

Photo: © Jihyun Jung. All rights reserved. 

#herzogdemeuron #hdm473 #hdm_museums #songeunartspace #seoul

node.text:
The ground breaking for Power Station took place today, marking the start of site work for the mixed-use project designed by HdM in collaboration with Adamson Associates.
 
On a former industrial site along the bay, Power Station consists of the adaptive reuse of an early 20th century brick power plant that once supplied power to the city of San Francisco. The turbine hall space will be largely retained, and the concrete turbine foundations will support new structure for the lightweight steel-framed addition above. The platforms which once supported machinery for power generation will house gathering spaces overlooking the open turbine hall. Exterior overhangs, natural ventilation strategies and the upper addition’s efficient structure contribute toward the goal of sustainably repurposing this relic of heavy industry.
 
Building on our experience in transforming historical structures including the Tate Modern in London, Caixaforum in Madrid and Elbphilharmonie in Hamburg, we are honored to continue our work in the Bay area and look forward to realizing this important project. 
 
@iamthestack 
 
#herzogdemeuron #hdm529 #powerstation #sanfrancisco #reuse

node.text:
In memory of Terence Riley, architect, curator, and museum director. We have lost a patron and a friend. As the director of PAMM and an architect himself, he was a unique client, an extremely knowledgeable colleague and an articulate critic. As a curator and author he accompanied us on our journey. As a humanist, he was a life teacher. 

We are extremely grateful for Terry’s generosity. We mourn the passing of a life-long companion with great sadness.

Terence Riley, 1954–2021 | 2021-05-19 

https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/21/arts/terence-riley-dead.html?referringSource=articleShare

node.text:
ON SITE: The curved concrete wall of Lombard Odier New Headquarters has been revealed. Left in its raw state, this ‘mur courbe’ takes on the grain of the wooden form work and creates the main spatial element of the auditorium. From this moment onwards, the interior topography of sweeping contours and cantilevered slabs unfurls. Congratulations to all involved in achieving this milestone, as construction continues on the site beside Lake Geneva. 

@lombardodier 
 

Video & Images: Filip Niketic & Nicolas Fehlmann Ingénieurs Conseils SA

#hdm_onsite #herzogdemeuron #hdm480 #lombardodier #lakegeneva #switzerland #constructionperret #consortiumciii

node.text:
Toggenburg Bergbahnen TBB AG, the client for Chäserrugg, was recently awarded the "Landschaft des Jahres 2021" prize by Stiftung Landschaftsschutz Schweiz.

The "Landscape of the Year 2021" prize awarded by the Swiss Foundation for Protected Landscape recognizes the careful renewal of touristic infrastructure in a highly sensitive environment. Within this context, HdM’s design for five buildings was commended for its precise and sustainable interventions and for a path-breaking project in alpine construction. 

@chaeserrugg 

Photos: © Katalin Déer

#herzogdemeuron #hdm374 #chaeserrugg #unterwasser #switzerland #sustainability #landscape

node.text:
Construction of the M+ museum building is now officially complete! @mplusmuseum staff are occupying the building and preparing for a public opening in late 2021.

Located in Hong Kong’s West Kowloon Cultural District on the Victoria Harbour waterfront, the building sits on land reclaimed from the sea. The site is intersected by an underground railway tunnel; excavation revealed this distinctive feature as a “found space” to hold large-scale installations. Hovering above this found landscape, a horizontal volume houses a series of exhibition spaces. A vertical extension sits above, containing research facilities, artist-in-residence studios and curatorial offices.

M+ is a public forum, a built platform for the exchange, encounter and activity of people and art. Facing the waterfront, a façade with integrated LED lighting activates the building as a city-scaled display. Seen here showing a white screen test, the façade will invite future artist participation. 

For the M+ project, HdM have formed a design team with @farrellsarchitects as local partner architect and with @arupgroup as an engineering consultant. 

@mplusmuseum 
@westkowloon 
 
Photos: Kevin Mak
© Kevin Mak | @kingymak @1kmstudio 

Final photo: Virgile Simon Bertrand
© Virgile Simon Bertrand | @virgilebertrand_hk_photo 
 
#herzogdemeuron #hdm415 #hdm_museums #mplusmuseum #mplusbuilding #hongkong

node.text:
LIGHTS-ON: 133 Studio Rémy Zaugg, Mulhouse, France (1996). 

Rémy Zaugg was born on 11 January 1943, and would have turned 78 this week. The studio was designed in close collaboration with the artist to function as both a place of work and a place to present and view art; a small, light-filled museum. 

The interior is captured by Christian Richters, the garden by Ruedi Walti. 

#herzogdemeuron #hdm133 #hdm_lightson #studioremyzaugg #mulhouse

node.text:
DAILY LIFE: 153 Aargauer Kunsthaus, Aarau, Switzerland. This week, we took a visit to the museum - enjoy the series from an insider’s perspective!

The extension of the museum is conceived as an elevated and planted urban terrace. From the rooftop, the surrounding buildings make for a rich historical ensemble; three architectures from three different eras. The concrete façade frames the artwork of Rémy Zaugg (1943-2005), HdM’s long-time collaborator and friend: “ICH, DAS BILD, ICH SEHE.” / “I, THE PICTURE, I SEE.”

Evoking the circular staircase of the old museum, the spiral stair functions as a kind of inhabitable sculpture; a green glass atrium marks the entrance to new extension. From the crystalline interior of the lobby, green glass runs throughout the museum as an articulated link from inside to out. 

#herzogdemeuron #hdm_dailylife #hdm153 #aargauerkunsthaus #aarau
